etymology.description: 毛 (surname) + 泽东 (given name ‘beneficence to the East’) = Mao Zedong.
etymology.interpretation: Common surname paired with a two-character given name literally meaning ‘grace/beneficence to the East’. Refers to the 20th‑century Chinese leader, founder of the PRC.
etymology.simplification: 泽东 simplifies 澤東: 泽 is the simplified form of 澤 (water radical retained with reduced phonetic), and 东 simplifies 東 by streamlining interior strokes; PRC character simplification applied uniformly, including personal names.

parts.english: beneficence to the East; grace to the East; marsh-east (lit.); to favor the East (lit.)

examples.chinese: 毛泽东(毛澤東)是中国的革命家和政治家。
examples.pinyin: Máo Zédōng shì Zhōngguó de gémìngjiā hé zhèngzhìjiā.
examples.english: Mao Zedong was a Chinese revolutionary and statesman.

examples.chinese: 很多地名和机构以毛泽东(毛澤東)命名。
examples.pinyin: Hěn duō dìmíng hé jīgòu yǐ Máo Zédōng mìngmíng.
examples.english: Many place names and institutions are named after Mao Zedong.

examples.chinese: 学者们研究毛泽东(毛澤東)思想的历史影响。
examples.pinyin: Xuézhěmen yánjiū Máo Zédōng sīxiǎng de lìshǐ yǐngxiǎng.
examples.english: Scholars study the historical impact of Mao Zedong Thought.
